title_result: Hearing of the House Judiciary Committee Subject: "H.R. 2278, the "Strengthen and Fortify Enforcement (SAFE) Act," to Amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to Improve Immigration Law Enforcement Within the Interior of the United States" Chaired by: Representative Robert Goodlatte (R-VA) Witnesses: Paul Babeu, Sheriff, Pinal County, Florence, Arizona; Chris Crane, President, National Immigration and Customs Enforcement Council 118, American Federation of Government Employees; Sam Page, Sheriff, Rockingham County, Wentworth, North Carolina; Jamiel Shaw Sr., Jamiel's Law, Los Angeles, California; Randy Krantz, Commonwealth's Attorney, Bedford, Virginia; Sabine Durden, Mother of Dominic Durden, Moreno Valley, California; Karen Tumlin, Managing Attorney, National Immigration Law Center; Clarissa Martinez De Castro, Director of Civic Engagement and Immigration, National Council La Raza Location: 2141 Rayburn House Office Building, Washington, D.C. Time: 2:00 p.m. EDT Date: Thursday, June 13, 2013
